title: BBC Local Live: Devon & Cornwall on Monday 31 October 2016 - BBC News
summary: fifty firefighters continue to damp down the historic royal clarence hotel following a major blaze .
the fire started on friday in a nearby gallery and spread to the hotel .
demolition equipment is expected to arrive today .
in other news , firefighters tackle large barn fire in united downs .
two dead in car and van crash on a303 .
patients who 've had a stroke could now get medication in the ambulance on the way to hospital .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all from bbc local live in devon & cornwall for today , we 'll be back at 08:00 to bring you all the day 's news , sport , travel and weather updates .
do n't miss bbc spotlight at 18:30 and the late bulletin at 22:30 tonight .
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: exeter fire : hotel demolition due to start on tuesday
text: demolition work on the remains of royal clarence hotel is expected to begin tomorrow , engineers have told the bbc .
engineers from demolition contractor wring group have begun to put up a cordon around the site after examining the remains of the building .
author: Simon Hall, Home Affairs Correspondent
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: death of a man from devon part of welsh drug investigation
text: a man died and two people were arrested on sus of drug offences following an illegal rave on the weekend , south wales police have said .
about 2,000 people attended the event at a disused warehouse on hayes road , barry , vale of glamorgan , with officers called early on sunday .
the death of a 45-year-old man from torbay in devon is being investigated , but police said it is not being treated as sus
author: BBC Wales News

documents.title: slavery gang jailed for offences
text: members of a slavery gang responsible for `` the crushing of the human spirit '' have all been jailed .
all five defendants were found guilty last week and were given the following sentences in plymouth 's crown court :
what seems to have escaped all five of you is this , these offences centre around the crushing of the human spirit and the stripping away of a person 's freedom of choice . ''
author: Claire Jones
BBC News Online

documents.title: allergic beekeeper dies from bee sting
text: an amateur beekeeper died when a bee stung him on the neck inside his protective suit .
mark turner tried to use an epipen to counter the severe allergic reaction but spilled the contents , an inquest at exeter 's county hall heard .
his wife then successfully injected into his leg but he died from the reaction to the sting at his home on dartmoor , devon .
the coroner recorded a conclusion of accidental death .
author: Miles Davis
BBC News Online

documents.title: cornish pasty museum appeals for help
text: the team behind cornwall 's 'pasty museum ' , set to open next year , has appealed for help to tell the story of the world-famous pastry snack .

the cornish pasty heritage centre , which will open on the outskirts of st austell as part of new attraction cornucopia , has asked for pasty lovers to lend or donate any artefacts that show the development of the pasty and how the cornish copper and tin miners introduced to them to far-flung corners of the globe as they sought work in overseas mines .
sam healy , from wmc retail partners plc , said there was a `` fascinating and rich story to tell '' .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: girl passenger , 15 , seriously hurt as car overturns
text: a 15-year-old girl was seriously injured after a car she was in careered off the road into a hedge .
the teenager from whitstone in cornwall was being driven by a 17-year-old boy when the car flipped over and landed on its roof .
the girl suffered a `` significant head injury '' , said police .
she 's being treated at bristol children 's hospital .
the driver , from bideford was checked over and released .
police want to speak to anyone who saw the crash at 18:40 on saturday on the b3254 near to willsworthy cross .
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: weather : fog overnight will slowly clear , but expect light rain
text: staying mild for many overnight .
light winds will lead to mist and fog forming in some spots , with low cloud and hill fog over bodmin moor , dartmoor and other higher ground .
minimum temperature : 8c ( 46f ) .

fog slowly clearing during the morning , but then becoming cloudier , perhaps with a little light rain or drizzle in the afternoon , and feeling cooler than today , maximum temperature : 15c ( 59f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: exeter fire : twenty businesses reopen , but many remain closed
text: twenty businesses affected by the royal clarence hotel fire in exeter have now reopened .
others including house of fraser remain closed while firefighters continue to pour water on the remains of the 300-year-old building .
demolition crews are on site assessing the damage .
this morning the hotel 's owner said he has every intention of rebuilding the royal clarence .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: puppies abandoned by side of road
text: terrier puppies were dumped by the side of the road in a cardboard box .
cornwall council said three puppies were abandoned by the road in camelford on thursday .
the puppies are thought to have mange and are being cared for by an animal rehoming charity .
anyone with any information regarding the possible owners of the puppies is asked to contact the council .
author: Miles Davis
BBC News Online

documents.title: skeletons to be removed from pub cellar amid the exeter fire rubble
text: human remains may have to be removed from the rubble left by the devastating exeter fire .
author: Exeter Express & Echo

documents.title: exeter fire : police 'constantly reviewing cordons '
text: cordoned off area around royal clarence is reduced .
20 shops , that were closed , re-opened today # exeter fire .
some shops still shut
we are constantly reviewing the cordons and safety - the public have been amazing supporting the emergency services .
@ twitterid @ twitterid police doing a great job , and we the public support you .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: exeter fire : 'despite loss of buildings , it could have been much worse '
text: fire crews remain at the scene of a huge blaze in exeter .
on friday the royal clarence hotel was among the buildings destroyed in the blaze .
councillor mark healey , chairman of the devon and somerset fire and rescue authority , said : `` despite the loss of a number of buildings , it could have been so much worse . ''
chief fire officer lee howell said : `` this was an intense fire affecting several historically important buildings in the heart of the city .
`` we will continue to dampen down hotspots , check for potential re-ignition and support the demolition process for as long as necessary . ''
author: Press Association

documents.title: two dead in car and van crash on a303
text: two people have died following a crash on the a303 near buckland st michael in somerset .
the collision involved a car and a van and happened just after 13:00 .
police say a stretch of the road has been closed while an investigation into the cause of the crash takes place .
author: Ben Chapple
BBC News Online

documents.title: a303 closed after serious van and car crash
text: one of the main roads into devon is closed after a serious crash between a van and a car .
it happened just after 13:00 on the a303 at buckland st mary east of honiton .
the road is closed in both directions while the fire and ambulance services deal with the incident .
police say motorists should avoid the area and use the m5 and a358 instead .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: exeter fire : exclusion zone in place
text: a metal fence exclusion zone is being put up by the demolition team .
author: Clare Woodling
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: traders hope blaze cordons will be removed today
text: `` i 'm hopeful by the end of the day cordons will be taken away , '' said derek phillips , vice president of the exeter chamber of commerce on the road closures put in place after the fire at the royal clarence hotel .
`` they have been moved during the day , but this has been in yards , not hundreds of yards , '' he said .
`` but it is moving .
we want to get the message across , that exeter is open for business .
it 's been four days , so four trading days which is considerable . ''
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: new takeover offers for torquay united
text: struggling national league club torquay united are considering at least two takeover offers .
the gulls have been in financial difficulty since lottery-winning former owner thea bristow left in the summer of 2015 and a new consortium took over .
the club had an agreement with swindon-based gaming international , but they pulled out of a takeover deal in july .
`` there are two definite offers , and possibilities for others , '' chairman david phillips told bbc sport .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: exeter fire : more streets open
text: goldsmiths street and gandy street now open , all other cordons remain in place .
structural engineers continue to work at scene # exeterfire

documents.title: police appeal to find missing woman who might be in cornwall
text: police are trying to find tina gibbons , 53 , who is from taunton , but is believed to be in the carrick area of cornwall .
tina was last seen in zelah , cornwall , at around 17:00 on sunday .
she was seen walking on the a30 at carminow in cornwall .
tina also has her car with her - a silver ford ka and is described as 5 ' 6 '' tall , of a medium build , with dark brown hair .
she was last seen she was wearing a dark waterproof coat and black trousers .

documents.title: exeter fire : every floor of hotel destroyed
text: every floor of the royal clarence destroyed in the # exeterfire
@ twitterid was this building in use at the time ?

documents.title: bid to quash tanis murder conviction suffers major setback
text: moves to overturn the conviction of donald pemberton - who was jailed for life following the murder of tanis bhandari - were dealt a blow in the court of appeal today .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: exeter fire : engineers examine remains
text: engineers from demolition contractor wring group arrive at cathedral green to examine the remains of the royal clarence hotel .
author: Simon Hall, Home Affairs Correspondent
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: home win 'is coming ' says exeter boss
text: exeter city manager paul tisdale is confident his side will replicate their away form at st james park very soon .
exeter impressed in a 3-0 win at morecambe , their fifth away victory of the season , but have not won at home in league two since april .
`` there are a lot of people that want that kind of performance at home , me included , and the players are ready for it , it 's coming , '' tisdale said .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: barn fire : teen 'distressed to lose family livelihood '
text: the 18-year-old owner of a fire wood business near redruth that burnt down overnight says he 's very distressed to lose the family livelihood that his dad left to him and his brother only last month .
firefighters spent several hours tackling the blaze in the barn in united downs which contained more than £ 20,000 worth of stock .
fire crews say they had to deal with intense heat in the blaze because of the amount of firewood involved .
swing shovel now helping to reveal hotspots at united downs wood yard fire - 8 @ twitterid crews have now been on site
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: paignton hospital staff move 'does not mean hospital closure is decided '
text: health chiefs have denied moving paignton hospital staff to new offices at kings ash is jumping the gun on the hospital 's proposed closure .
author: Torquay Herald Express

documents.title: royal clarence hotel guest 'woken by raging sound of fire '
text: `` what woke me was the raging sound of the fire , '' said hotel guest nick groom describing his escape with wife annie from the inferno which engulfed the royal clarence hotel .
`` we ran down through the hotel shouting 'fire ! '
`` the fire was on the roof right outside our bedroom window . ''
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: exeter fire-destroyed art gallery thanks emergency services
text: the art gallery , where the fire which destroyed the royal clarence hotel started , has thanked emergency services `` for their incredible work over the past few days '' .
castle fine art exeter was destroyed in the blaze which started on friday .

`` we will continue working with the authorities during the investigation , as well as our artists , employees , clients and partners , who have been deeply affected by this , '' said managing director tara tomes .
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: exeter chiefs face 'test of character '
text: exeter head coach rob baxter says his side 's character faces a major test after sunday 's late defeat by bath .

the chiefs lost after a stoppage-time try from semesa rokoduguni , their fifth game without a win and the third time they have lost to a late score , leaving last season 's runners-up in seventh place in the premiership .
`` when you look a the table now and the results we 've had you can start to set yourselves some new challenges , '' baxter told bbc sport .
`` i do n't mean we 're going to give up on having a good season , but the challenges now are more a test of character . ''
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: exeter fire : more than 30 businesses remain closed
text: we can report that 20 businesses are in the process of being reopened while 32 business still remain closed .

documents.title: referee out of hospital after neck injury
text: referee kevin johnson has been let out of hospital after being stretchered off with a neck injury during plymouth 's league two victory over colchester .
he was kept in hospital overnight in plymouth suffering from neck ligament damage and blurred vision .
the game was suspended for 15 minutes following an accidental collision with argyle striker jimmy spencer , and johnson was replaced by simon knapp .
`` he wo n't be refereeing for the next few weeks , '' an english football league spokesman told bbc sport .
`` his progress will be monitored and we wish him a speedy recovery . ''
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: royal clarence hotel fire fails to dampen wedding day
text: a couple saved their wedding day after exeter 's royal clarence hotel was destroyed by fire .

their wedding venue , exeter city council 's guildhall , was cordoned off after the fire on friday but nikki and fraser burling-hobbs , both 31 , went ahead after staff `` were kind enough '' to liaise with police for clearance .
carer nikki was escorted to the site by officers and walked down the aisle the wrong way as the main entrance was blocked .
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: royal clarence hotel guests 'very lucky to be alive '
text: a guest at the royal clarence hotel , which was destroyed by fire said he and his wife were `` very lucky '' to escape alive .
nick groom , who lives in france , was visiting exeter with his wife annie when he was `` woken to the sound of an inferno and breaking glass '' .
`` i dived out of bed grabbed my wife annie from bed and said we 've got ta get out of here , '' he said .
`` we tried to open the door and it was blocked . ''
he said he ran upstairs to find the key .
`` i grabbed a pair of boots and two dressing gowns and my wife had managed to get the door open .
`` inside the room it was terrifying with the orange of the flames .
`` we found the corridor in peace with the lights on .
the juxtaposition was incredibly strange .
`` we ran through the hotel shouting 'fire ' .
reception were calling fire services .
`` we got onto the green and realised we were very lucky . ''
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: exeter fire : cordons to 'remain until tuesday at least '
text: cordons on part of exeter high street and all of cathedral green will remain in place until at least tomorrow , .
the fire service has told the bbc .
author: Simon Hall, Home Affairs Correspondent
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: redruth 's fuca has 300th game to forget
text: redruth forward chris fuca had a 300th game for the club to forget as the reds lost 43-25 at national two south high-fliers old elthamians .
the cornish side were three tries behind at half time as they suffered their second defeat of the season .
`` it 's probably not one he would want to remember , but he was outstanding throughout the game , '' head coach marek churcher said of the veteran back-row .
`` it 's important people look at him and his honesty and loyalty to the club . ''
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: iconic landmark brown willy is under offer just weeks after going on the market for £ 2.8 million
text: one of the most iconic and rugged parts of cornwall could soon have a new owner .
author: West Briton

documents.title: royal clarence hotel blaze : fire service says it was there within six minutes
text: devon and somerset fire and rescue service said it was at the scene of a blaze in a gallery next to the royal clarence hotel within six minutes of receiving the first call .
a spokeswoman said the first fire engine from the danes castle station was at the scene at 05:18 following the call at 05:12 .
that is well within the fire services average response time of about 10 minutes .
it followed claims from a hotel guest that it took 25 minutes for the first fire engine to arrive .
nick groom , who was standing on the cathedral green after fleeing the fire , told bbc radio devon : `` we were on the green for 25 minutes before one engine arrived .
`` no-one could believe we were witnessing the total destruction of a building and no-one could do anything about it at all . ''
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: royal clarence hotel fire : owner 'extremely proud ' of staff
text: `` amidst the tragedy , i have been reminded of the commitment , professionalism and dedication of so many people , and i would like to thank everyone for their overwhelming support .

`` hotel general manager john badley and his team not only fulfilled the most important function they could have done by ensuring all guests and staff were evacuated safely , but have since continued to offer help and support to all guests in a positive and extraordinarily professional manner .
i am extremely proud of all the team . ''

documents.title: paranormal or just normal ?
text: mark rablin is the resident medium at bodmin jail in cornwall .
that means he takes visitors on overnight tours of the old prison , searching for signs of paranormal activity .
more than 50 executions took place at the former jail , which was in operation between 1779 and 1927 .

documents.title: fire service 'took 25 minutes ' to reach exeter royal clarence hotel fire
text: the fire service took 25 minutes to reach the royal clarence hotel fire says the man who was the first to raise the alarm .
nick groom was asleep in the hotel on friday morning when the sound of flames , smashing windows and creaking timbers from the art gallery next door woke him and his wife .
he says that as hotel guests gathered on cathedral green it took 25 minutes for the first fire truck to arrive .
`` at that time , knowing the fire brigade had been called , we thought that within five or 10 minutes they would be here and get on with the job and very quickly this will become extinguished .
`` we were on the green for 25 minutes before one engine arrived .
no-one could believe we were witnessing the total destruction of a building and no-one could do anything about it at all , '' he said .

the person in charge of the initial operation said that as well as trying to stop the fire spreading from the art gallery , firefighters had to go from room to room inside the hotel to ensure guests had got out safely .
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: exeter fire : 25 city centre shops and businesses remain closed ahead of hotel demolition
text: at least 25 shops and businesses across exeter city centre remain closed today following the devastating fire .
author: West Briton

documents.title: royal clarence owner : 'every intention to rebuild hotel '
text: in a statement , owner andrew brownsword said : `` looking to the future of the royal clarence , we have every intention to rebuild the hotel with enormous sympathy to its importance and heritage , and to make it once again a building that the city of exeter will be proud of .

`` we have always said we believe we are merely custodians of the buildings our hotels operate within , and we pledge to do our very best to return the royal clarence to the city of exeter and its people . ''

documents.title: truro have 'weak underbelly ' , says boss
text: truro city boss lee hodges is worried by his side 's lack of mental strength after a 5-0 loss at st albans city .
the white tigers conceded three times in the final 30 minutes after failing to take a number of first-half chances .

`` at the moment we 're a little bit weak and we conceded and seemed to not give up , but all go into our shells rather than stick our chests out and keep working hard , '' hodges told bbc radio cornwall .
`` we 've got a weak underbelly at the moment and it 's not enjoyable . ''
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: royal clarence hotel fire : 'heartbreaking ' to see the building now says owner
text: my family and i have witnessed the events that unfolded since friday with great sadness .
the royal clarence hotel has long been a special place for us all , and to see the building now is heartbreaking .
alongside many of exeter 's residents and visitors , we share a huge sense of loss of such an iconic building , and remember fondly our memories of happy times there .

documents.title: 10 year old st ives boy thrilled at nasa response to his plans for mission to mars
text: a 10-year-old boy from cornwall has been told by nasa that he could one day play a pioneering role in humankind 's journey to the stars .
author: West Briton

documents.title: police photos of the scene as some roads reopen
text: devon and cornwall police said : `` north street and south street have now reopened , all other cordons remain in place .
`` structural engineers continue to work at the scene and once further and wider decisions have been made in relation to recovery at the scene , we will share this with the public . ''

documents.title: 'important buildings saved ' in exeter royal clarence hotel blaze
text: `` there are other more important 1400s buildings than the royal clarence that have been saved '' todd gray # exeterfire
there may be older buildings , but few more important to the city 's fabric .
if walls could tell stories # exeterfire
i think dr todd gray is missing the point there , the # royalclarence was the social heart of the city for two centuries # exeterfire
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: pirates to blame for late loss - cattle
text: cornish pirates joint-head coach gavin cattle said they only had themselves to blame for the 26-24 loss at rotherham .
rotherham kicked a last-minute penalty to seal the win after the pirates had been reduced to 12 men following yellow cards for matt evans , tom channon , and brett beukeboom late on .
`` we got what we deserved , we ca n't hide away from the fact that we left three or four tries out there , '' cattle told bbc radio cornwall .
`` there 'll be a lot of talk about the yellow cards at the end of the game where we were fighting for our lives . ''
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: exeter fire : what happened and what we know so far
text: exeter fire : what happened and what we know so far
author: Chris Ellis
BBC News Online

documents.title: exeter fire : some streets opened
text: once further and wider decisions have been made in relation to recovery at the scene , we will share this with the public .
2/2 # exeterfire
north street and south street opened , all other cordons remain in place .
structural engineers continue to work at the scene 1/2 # exeterfire

documents.title: cornwall council urged not to spend money fighting 'devonwall '
text: cornwall council is being urged not to spend taxpayers ' money on a legal challenge to controversial plans for a cross-tamar `` devonwall '' parliamentary constituency by the conservative group leader at cornwall council .
a bideford , bude and launceston seat would be created under current boundary reform which the government says is more democratic and saves money .
talking to @ twitterid cllr john keeling urges @ twitterid not to spend money on legal challenge to # devonwall proposals
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: royal clarence hotel fire 'very difficult to deal with '
text: the fire which destroyed the royal clarence hotel in exeter was `` intense '' and the `` complex nature of the building construction , especially the roof structure , made this a very difficult incident to deal with '' says chief fire officer lee howell .

he said : i am very proud of the efforts of our firefighting , control , officer and support staff , many of whom worked extremely hard for extended periods of time without complaining during what were very challenging circumstances .
it was an incredible effort by firefighters to stop the fire spreading to other heritage buildings on the high street .

`` due to the period in which the buildings were constructed , the gap between the back of the hotel and the adjacent properties was very narrow and the fire was threatening to bridge the gap and spread further . ''
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: exeter fire in numbers
text: at the height of the fire
source : devon and somerset fire and rescue service
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: fire service 'grateful ' to residents after hotel blaze
text: we would like to give our grateful thanks to residents and business owners for all their support during # exeterfire
@ twitterid we need to thank the fire crews and other agencies for their hard work in containing the fire as they did .

documents.title: weather for devon and cornwall : staying fine and mild
text: any patches of cloud , mist or fog will lift through the morning to leave a fine afternoon with plenty of sunshine .
with winds remaining light , it will stay mild for the time of year .
maximum temperature : 18 deg c ( 64 deg f ) .
author: Holly Green
BBC Weather

documents.title: smoke billows from cornwall united downs wood yard fire
text: firefighters from tolvaddon and falmouth are dealing with a large barn fire in united downs .
the barn is believed to contain wood and power to the building has been isolated .
devon and cornwall police are also at the scene .
fire in wood yard at united downs - 30x30m barn full of timber burning since 0300 - 4 crews from @ twitterid on the scene
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: facebook live : royal clarence hotel latest
text: facebook live : royal clarence hotel latest
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: exeter fire : public support 'amazing '
text: councillor mark healey , chairman of the devon & somerset fire & rescue authority , said : the support of the public has been amazing .
`` i visited the scene yesterday with the chief fire officer and we spoke with a number of local business owners to say thank you for their support to our crews .
in difficult times , communities come together and the events of the last few days has seen this happen on a large scale .
despite the loss of a number of buildings , it could have been so much worse .
i 'm just so pleased no-one has been injured . ''
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: exeter city council 'doing everything ' to support businesses after royal clarence hotel fire
text: `` we do everything in the council 's power to support businesses . ''
karime hassan # exeterfire

documents.title: businesses and residents thanked for support during royal clarence hotel fire
text: devon and somerset fire & rescue service has thanked the residents and business owners of exeter for their support during the major blaze .
since the fire started in the early hours of friday morning , roads have been closed , cordons put in place and businesses closed to protect public safety .

despite the inconvenience , the service said it had been `` overwhelmed by messages of support , offers of assistance and complimentary food and drink to help sustain the large number of firefighters who have been working around the clock to bring the fire under control '' .
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: 'i grabbed my wife ' says royal clarence hotel fire victim
text: `` i grabbed my wife and said 'we 've got to get out of here '' nick groom , the first to raise the alarm # exeterfire

documents.title: views of royal clarence hotel after fire
text: at the end of an emotional weekend , the words in the window of a cafe only metres from the royal clarence hotel
author: Simon Hall, Home Affairs Correspondent
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: four fire crews tackle barn fire in cornwall
text: 4 crews from @ twitterid pumping water onto barn fire at united downs .
30x30m building full of timber - reporter @ twitterid on scene
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: weather watchers : early morning across the region
text: some mist and thin high cloud making a good combination for the early photographers # bbcweatherwatchers around devon and cornwall
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: royal clarence hotel to be demolished later this week
text: site inspections are being carried out by structural engineers and demolition work on the remainder of the royal clarence hotel is likely to start this week .
that 's what devon and somerset fire service is saying , warning that `` it will be a difficult and challenging process that will take some time '' .
it said : `` while some roads will be able to re-open , cordons will continue to be in place around the immediate vicinity of the affected area .
`` the majority of the city centre remains open for business . ''
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: fire crews tackle large barn fire
text: firefighters from tolvaddon and falmouth are dealing with a large barn fire in united downs .
the barn is believed to contain wood and power to the building has been isolated .
devon and cornwall police are also on scene .
united road is closed which is having an impact on traffic to and from the industrial estate .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: exeter fire : just a shell remains
text: a shell now .
the royal clarence hotel building had survived the blitz @ twitterid @ twitterid
author: Harriet Bradshaw
Reporter

documents.title: headlines for devon and cornwall
text: headlines for devon and cornwall
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: at the scene : 'beautiful sunrise '
text: radio devon 's richard green is at castle green this morning where a fire destroyed the royal clarence hotel .
he tweeted : `` beautiful sunrise and sky over the scene of the royal clarence # exeterfire ''
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: welcome to bbc local live for devon and cornwall
text: welcome to bbc local live in devon & cornwall .
we 'll be bringing you all the day 's news , sport , weather and travel .
if you have a story email us .
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online
